document.docAuthor: Wang, Lin-Fei, Zhou, Hong-Zhang & Lü, Liang
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Anotylus sculpturatus group (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Oxytelinae) with descriptions of seven new species from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Anotylus sculpturatus group (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Oxytelinae) with descriptions of seven new species from China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species :
Oxytelus sculpturatus Gravenhorst
, fixed by monotypy and original designation.

Syn.:
Styloxys Gozis, 1886 : 15
(species included:
rugosus
); Herman, 1970: 414 (synonym of
Anotylus
). Type species:
Staphylinus rugosus Fabricius
, fixed by monotypy.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Delopsis
Fauvel, 1895 : 198
(species included:
cornuta
,
seticornis
);
Blackwelder, 1952 : 342
(replaced by
Rimba
). Type species:
Delopsis cornuta Fauvel
, fixed by subsequent designation by R. Lucas, 1920: 228.

Oxytelopsis
Fauvel, 1895 : 199
(species included: apicipennis ,
cimicoides
, pseudopsina );
Makranczy, 2006 : 75
(synonym of
Anotylus
). Type species:
Oxytelopsis cimicoides Fauvel
, fixed by
Blackwelder, 1952 : 282
.

Oxytelodes
Bernhauer, 1908 : 290
(species included:
holdhausi
); Herman, 1970: 414 (synonym of
Anotylus
). Type species:
Oxytelodes holdhausi Bernhauer
, fixed by monotypy.

Emopotylus
Bernhauer, 1910 : 359
(subgenus of
Oxytelus
; species included:
cuernavacanus
); Herman, 1970: 414 (synonym of
Anotylus
). Type species:
Oxytelus ( Emopotylus ) cuernavacanus Bernhauer
, fixed by monotypy.

Boettcherinus
Bernhauer, 1936a : 82
(species included:
planaticollis
, cornutus , militaris , bispinosus , bidentatus ); Herman, 1970: 414 (synonym of
Anotylus
). Type species:
Oxytelus ( Boettcherinus ) planaticollis Bernhauer
, fixed by subsequent designation by
Blackwelder, 1952 : 79
.

Oncoparia
Bernhauer, 1936b : 214
(species included:
parasita
);
Hammond, 1976a : 145
(synonym of
Anotylus
). Type species:
Oncoparia parasita Bernhauer
, fixed by monotypy.

Paracaccoporus
Steel, 1948 : 188
(subgenus of
Oxytelus
; species included:
ocularis
); Herman, 1970: 414 (synonym of
Anotylus
). Type species:
Oxytelus ocularis Fauvel
, fixed by original designation and monotypy.

Oxytelosus
Cameron, 1950 : 92
(species included: abnornalis “and no doubt” mirus ); Herman, 1970: 414 (synonym of
Anotylus
; notes). Type species:
Oxytelus abnormalis Cameron
, fixed by virtual monotypy.

Rimba
Blackwelder, 1952 : 342
(replacement name for
Delopsis Fauvel
);
Makranczy, 2006 : 75
(synonym of
Anotylus
). Type species:
Delopsis cornuta Fauvel
, fixed by objective synonym with
Delopsis .

Microxytelus
Fagel, 1956 : 272
(species included:
nitidifrons
); Herman, 1970: 414 (synonym of
Anotylus
). Type species:
Oxytelus nitidifrons Wollaston
, fixed by original designation and monotypy.

Oxytelops
Fagel, 1956 : 273
(species included:
tetracarinatus
); Herman, 1970: 414 (synonym of
Anotylus
). Type species:
Staphylinus tetracarinatus Block
, fixed by original designation and monotypy.

Pseudodelopsis
Fagel, 1957a : 3
(species included:
scotti
, tolaensis , lungwensis ); Herman, 1970: 414 (synonym of
Anotylus
). Type species:
Pseudodelopsis scotti Fagel
, fixed by original designation.

Anotylops
Fagel, 1957 : 8
(species included:
seydeli
);
Hammond, 1976a : 145
(synonym of
Anotylus
). Type species:
Anotylops seydeli Fagel
, fixed by original designation and monotypy.

sulcicollis

Hammond, 1976a : 145
(synonym of
Anotylus
). Type species:
Oxytelus sulcicollis Gemminger and Harold

Hammond, 1976a : 146

(synonym of
Anotylus
). Type species:
Platystethus ( Pseudopyctocraerus ) mahmoodi Abdullah & Qadri
, fixed by original designation.

subSubSection.paragraph:
As a large genus of ca. 400 species worldwide ( Herman, 2001 ; Schülke and Smetana, 2015 ), the genus
Anotylus Thomson, 1859
can be separated by the following diagnostic features: scutellum with trilobed and crest-shaped impression; without basolateral ridges on tergite II; without tibial carinae; first and second tarsal articles nearly equal in length (Herman, 1970).

As a matter of fact, the infra-generic classification has been considered as one of the most difficult taxonomic issues for this genus, for their varying body sizes and different development of structures, often extreme cases of sexual dimorphism, the poorly known aedeagal structures in males (including complicated sclerites in the internal sac of the median lobe), but most of all, the very incompletely mapped diversity (both in terms of number of species and morphological disparity). As a result, it is perhaps not surprising that in the taxonomic history, rove beetle specialists did not try to erect many subgenera, rather used the more informal species groups ( Bernhauer, 1939 ; Herman, 1970; Hammond, 1975 , 1976b ; Schülke, 2012a , b ) as without doubt, the system will require many more changes. According to our study, we found also that this was the most suitable approach to the taxonomy of the genus
Anotylus
.
